{{Infobox Network Adapter |image1 = Intel_6235ANHMW.jpeg |image1_size = 150px |caption = <!-- tagline --> |caption2 = <!-- 2nd tagleine --> |pp = <!-- product page url only --> |sp = <!-- Support page url only --> |dl = <!-- Download page url only --> |wikidevi = <!-- wikidevi.wi-cat.ru page, included underscores --> |wikipedia = <!-- [[wikipedia:Main Page|Wikipedia]] Leave blank for none -->
|brand = Intel |model = Centrino Advanced-N 6235 |submodelappend = <!-- yes for space --> |submodel = <!-- SubModel number, Leave blank for unknown --> |revision = <!-- Model Revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |subrevision = <!-- Model Subrevision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |model_part_num = 6235ANHMW |page_start_date = October 11, 2011 |page_start_origon = https://wikidevi.com/wiki/Intel_Centrino_Advanced-N_6235_(MHF4) |sernum = <!-- Serial number prefix --> |wlclass = AN600 |series = <!-- Device series --> |if = Mini PCIe |if_bus_version = <!-- ie. 1.0, 1.1, 2.0, 2.2 --> |ifconnector = <!-- Interface Connector Type, Leave blank for none --> |formfactor = (half)
|vendor_id = 8086 |device_id = 088e |subvendor_id = 8086 |subdevice_id = 4060 |id_string = <!-- PnP ID string --> |windosid = <!-- Windows ID, Leave blank for none --> |fcc_id = PD96235ANH,PD96235ANHU |icid = 1000M-6235ANH |boardid = <!-- Board ID --> |ecc_id = <!-- eec-id --> |oui = C4:85:08
|chip1 = Intel;82549MDE; |chip2 = Intel;DL82550RDE; |chip3 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |chip4 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; -->
|antconn = MHF4 |antenna = <!-- Antenna type --> |txchains = 2 |rxchains = 2 |sstreams = 2 |wirelessstand = IEEE 802.11a/b/g/n |802.11n = 300/300 |802.11g = 54 |802.11b = 11 |802.11a = 54 |wififreq = 2.4 or 5 |receive_sens = <!-- Receive sensitivity --> |transmit_power = <!-- Transmit power -->
|linuxdriv = |windriv = [https://downloadcenter.intel.com/product/66890/Intel-Centrino-Advanced-N-6235-Dual-Band WLAN Driver], [https://downloadcenter.intel.com/Detail_Desc.aspx?lang=eng&DwnldId=23452 BT Driver]
|is_manuf = No |manuf = <!-- Manufacturer --> |manuf_model = <!-- Manufacturer Model --> |manuf_rev = <!-- Manufacturer Revision --> |addchip = <!-- Additional Chips --> |flags = Bluetooth, DFS, |802dot11_protocols = abgn |accessible_UART = No |accessible_JTAG = |category =
|availability = <!-- Market availability --> |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = 10/11/2011 |estreldate = <!-- Estimated release date --> |estprice = <!-- Estimated retail price in US dollars --> |upc = <!-- UPC number --> |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |countrymanuf = China
|powledcolor = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |connactled = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |spdledcolor = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |leddupcolor = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimmin = <!-- Size of device --> |weight = <!-- Weight of device -->
}}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== Some of these cards have standard U.FL antenna connectors, however, others (mostly those used in Ultrabooks?) use what [http://superuser.com/questions/539737/what-is-this-wireless-cards-connector instead] [http://hardforum.com/showthread.php?p=1039539993 appear to be] [http://www.ebay.com/itm/191890034640 MHF4].
